faqrow1.title: What if I don't have a team or an idea?
faqrow1.body: Don’t sweat it! Many hackers do not have complete teams or even an idea of what they will make before the event begins. We will be hosting team-forming activities at the start of the event, and even if you're a first-time hacker, there will be many others also looking for team members with whom you can pair. Also, feel free to share ideas with other attendees through our Facebook and Slack groups that we will share later.

faqrow1.title: Who can attend?
faqrow1.body: All undergraduate students from any university in the world are eligible, but students in and around Silicon Valley/Bay Area will be given preference. People that have finished their undergraduate studies within one year of the event date are also eligible. High school students are allowed if they are at least 18 years old.

faqrow1.title: How much does it cost?
faqrow1.body: SiliconHacks is free for all accepted hackers. We will provide your WiFi, meals, caffeine, swag, and workspace for the entire weekend.

faqrow1.title: How big should teams be? Can I hack alone?
faqrow1.body: We highly encourage you to build with a team. Teamwork is deeply rooted in the hacking ethos, and you'll have a better time building with your brightest peers. Teams should be at most four people.

faqrow1.title: What if I have another question?
faqrow1.body: Please feel free to reach out to us via Facebook, Twitter, or email at hacksilicon@gmail.com.

faqrow2.title: What is a hackathon?
faqrow2.body: Hackathons are really cool events where moonshot and crazy ideas come to life. You can build anything you want, hardware, software, you name it. Some of the world’s most innovative and widely used products are started in these concentrations of innovation! Want to know more? Readhere.

faqrow2.title: What resources will I have access to?
faqrow2.body: We plan to have mentors, hardware, and workshops available throughout the event. Please check back later for more details.

faqrow2.title: What should I make?
faqrow2.body: There are no limits except for one's own imagination. Judges will review your projects based on criteria such as creativity, effort, utility, complexity, and real-world social impact. For an idea of what social impact hackathon projects look like, check out Devpost.

faqrow2.title: What should I bring?
faqrow2.body: All attendees are required to bring a valid student or government-issued ID (like a driver's license) for entry. Laptops, sleeping bags, and toiletries are highly recommended. We will have iMacs at the venue available for attendees to use!

faqrow2.title: Is there a code of conduct?
faqrow2.body:
Yes. Here it is.
tl;dr: Don't be a jerk.

faqrow2.title: How will I get to the event?
faqrow2.body: There is a small possibility some car rides will reimbursed up to a certain amount, but don't rely on this. If possible, carpool with other other attendees to lower travel costs! Buses are currently not planned. Flights will not be reimbursed. Popular means of traveling in the Bay Area include BART, Caltrain, and Uber/Lyft.
